sentences: Once, on a completely ordinary morning, something incredible happened: magic suddenly became real!
People on the street could hardly believe what was happening.
They saw children floating in the air and dogs that could talk!

content.contentDescription: Four children and a dog holding sparkling magic wands. The children are smiling and three of them are floating in the air.

sentences: In a small village, the day began like any other.
But then people started casting spells.
A boy turned his apple into gold, and a woman made flowers grow out of her hand.

content.contentDescription: A boy holds a golden apple out to a girl who has flowers in her hair.

sentences: The scientists were confused but excited.
They had always thought that magic only existed in fairy tales.
Now they had the chance to study the impossible.

content.contentDescription: Scientists in lab coats and glasses looking at a glowing crystal ball.

sentences: Some people used the magic to play pranks, and that caused problems.
Cars flew through the air, and some buildings changed their colors!

content.contentDescription: Cars and buses flying through the air. The buildings in the background are very colorful.

sentences: Then, just as suddenly as the magic had come, it disappeared again.
The next day, everything was back to normal.
People talked about the magical day for a long time, but no one knew why it had happened or if it would ever happen again.

content.contentDescription: A group of people looking up in wonder at the night sky.

sentences: That day showed us that life is full of surprises.
Sometimes things happen that we could never have imagined.
And maybe, just maybe, magic is out there somewhere, waiting for the right moment to become reality again.
